metadata.Title: CVE-2017-0351 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
All versions of the NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contain a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer handler where a NULL pointer dereference caused by invalid user input may lead to denial of service or potential escalation of privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-367 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
libcuda1-375 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-367 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-375 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-367 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-libopencl1-375 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-367 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
nvidia-opencl-icd-375 - 375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> Per NVIDIA advisory, affects 375 and 381 driver branches

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-375 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '375.66-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
